p.span: Objects generation

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: Sometimes you need to create many objects vety fast. At the moment, the program allows you to produce the most simple generation: position of objects anf their characteristics are chosen randomly. Go to
Generation -> Special Generation (CTRL + G)
to open the generation window

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Left panel

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: There is only browser of patterns. It such like a browser in the main window, but here you olnly can read content

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Middle panel

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: Here, only those characteristics that can affect the development of the simulation, so here is no colorbox.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: About radius:
You can choose generation mode:

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: 1.Proportional

- radius depent to mass, so all objects have same dencities (It is very important to say that the k entered by you cannot be called Dencity, because the area of ​​a circle depends on the radius not linearly, but quadratically)

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: 2.Independent from mass
- radius generate randomly
Right panel

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: Various characteristics that doesn`t influence on simulation directly

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Free space - characteristic, showing the average free space around objects, the greater this value, the greater the average distance from one object to another.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: For more diverse simulations, it is possible to change the values ​​of the initial speed of the objects created.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Random speed is the maximum length of the velocity vector. Created objects will move in a random direction with a random speed not exceeding this value.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Radial speed - the speed at which an object scatter from the center (big bang effect)

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Tangential speed - the initial velocity of the circular motion of objects (whirlpool effect))

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Generation center - coordinates of the point around which generation will occur

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Generation colors - colors with which objects will be created (by default, all objects are black). When you select a template, the color will be set the same as the template.

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;
-qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Warning:

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:14pt; font-weight:600; color:#00aa00;

p.span: It is not recommended to enter too large values ​​of the number of objects (more than 500), because then the program will be very difficult to work (should be based on the characteristics of the PC)
In the future we plan to add multithreading, this will improve the performance of the program.
